page.title: 17THE BOLLIN VALLEY
page.content: The River Bollin rises in the Pennine Hills near Macclesfield and flows into the Manchester Ship Canal at the end of its 30 mile course.Near Bowdon the river passes the site of the motte and bailey castle which was built to guard the river crossing at Watlingford. There is reputed to have been a squirmish here among the forces of Henry II.The river passes under the A556 (Watling Street) and then its meanders through the fields of Little Bollington past the estate of Dunham Massey.The river used to provide the power for a corn mill in the 18th century.Now the river marks the boundary of Cheshire and the Borough of Trafford.
